text: is a Japanese athlete. He is best known as an equestrian who competed in the 2008 Summer Olympics and in the 2012 Summer Olympics.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "Yoshiaki Oiwa" ; retrieved 2012-7-30. ==Career== In the 2012 Olympics at London, he ranked first after dressage in the three-day eventing competition. "Japan's Oiwa storms into dressage lead," Bankok Post (Thailand). July 30, 2012; EventingNation.com, "Yoshiaki Oiwa of Japan is winning the Olympics after the dressage," July 29, 2012; retrieved 2012-7-30. He made history as the first Asian rider to lead any four-star three-day event after dressage.Cuckson, Philippa. "London 2012 Olympics: Yoshiaki Oiwa makes history in three-day event," July 29, 2012; excerpt, "'I have been concentrating on our team performance here, not the individual. It is very hard to take in,' Oiwa said"; retrieved 2012-7-30. ==Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1976 births Category:2008 Summer Olympics Category:2012 Summer Olympics Category:Dressage riders Category:Japanese equestrians Category:Living people Category:Olympic equestrians for Japan
title: Yoshiaki Oiwa
